channel.description: Recent content in C++ on Richard Millen

item.title: Google Test
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: ! W O R K ~ I N ~ P R O G R E S S ! Quiz 1 When are the SetUp() and TearDown() methods of a test fixture invoked? How do you tell Google Mock to throw an exception? How do you tell Google Mock to set the value of a variable? How do you tell Google Mock to delete an argument? How do you tell Google Mock to invoke a function?

item.title: C++, Part 1
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: ! W O R K ~ I N ~ P R O G R E S S ! Quiz 1 Explain why you might want to define your own type-specific swap function? Show Answers 1. 2. “Valuelike copy-assignment operator. > It is crucially important that the left-hand operand is destroyed and the right-hand operand is copied in a sequence that is correct even if an object is assigned to itself.
